p: N-(2-methyl-naphthyl)maleopimaric acid diimides and their methyl esters are white solids (m.p. 215–290 °C). They can be synthesized from maleopimaric acid, 2-methyl-1-naphtylamine and dimethyl sulfate according to Scheme 39, and using separation methods such as extraction, washing, drying, evaporation and recrystallization [ 106, 107]. They show significant antitumor cytotoxicity against several human cancer cell lines, especially NCI cells and MGC-803 cells [ 106].
